lines.text: [first lines]
general alarm. Car 22, go to 733 Spring Avenue, it's a 341, that is all.
Why did you come here?
I need money.
[last lines]
Well, there goes my pigeon!

[holding a grocery list]
Where'd this come from?
Somebody stuck it under the door.

[annoyed]
Uhh...
Don't you think it's kinda funny? Sticking a note under the door?
No! And don't go trying to make a mystery out of it! Somebody probably to busy to pick up the stuff.
Could be the Creeper.

[very annoyed]
Creeper, Creeper, Creeper! YOU GIVE ME THE CREEPS!
Well he could be. That'd be a swell reason why he wouldn't wanna see anyone, or come out, 'cept at night.
Well you've just gotta deliver these groceries. And don't forget the money! A dollar and a quarter.
OK... but I still think it could be...
I know! So he's The Creeper. Well you just creep along with that - I mean, hurry up with that stuff! And then get back and do the rest of your work!
Hal had a quick temper, but it certainly paid off on the football field.
You never can tell what a man will do when his mind's affected.
Well, there goes my pigeon!
